description: So the genius (i mean it) who programmed this, went trought all the trouble of syncing it with the sun instead of giving me a on/off button? Or sinking it with simple local time. I need to measure the alignment of the stars ? just give me an off button please. I just use my monitor settings to change the temp because without the on/off button its kinda useless. Red light is less energetic. The filter is really important and should be expanded as some monitors lack customizing features. which are expensive to impliment at a hardware level.
in Fedora 25 is Wayland defalt = RedShift is not working. You must switch to X.Org
summary: Perfect SW, but not working under Wayland

description: Works just like the f.lux.

But don't forget to add this to your /etc/geoclue/geoclue.conf :

[redshift]
allowed=true
system=false
users=
Needs to register itself in the GNOME 3 Location Services list of apps, though.
Simple but effective. Remember you might have to change geoclue.conf so redshift works with it.
A very handy app indeed.
Awesome! But not yet for wayland. Hope to have there an alternative soon.

In order for this program to work you need to use Xorg which is easy enough. At the login screen just click on the settings button and choose to run Fedora 25 using X. Nothing else need to install. 

Gets 4 stars because of the lack of Wayland support but it is new so I can't fault them. Just hope they are working on a fix.
summary: Works perfectly but not with Wayland

description: Not working in fedora 25.
Easily one of the more prominent programs available for Fedora and for good reason.
Don't even need to configure anything.
Note, doesn't work on Wayland yet but works great on Xorg.
Stopped working after update to Fedora 24.
On Fedora 25, don't forget to choose GNOME on Xorg.
Redshift is nice and all, but I'd like to have it active 24/7, regardless of the time.
Redshift functionality has been merged into GNOME as of F26 (also known as "Night light")

First, this app is awesome! So much easier to get running than f.lux's Linux version. Saves my eyes and head a lot of pain in the evenings.

The only two things I wish the GTK version had are an easy way to adjust color temperature (it's easy enough to do in the terminal, but it's a separate package that must be installed), and support for Wayland. With Fedora 25 defaulting to Wayland and other distros likely to follow suit, this will become a critical requirement. 

Get those two features, get 5 stars. Great app, though!

The need of this app to access location or otherwise it won't work is plain stupid. There are plenty of such apps such as twilight, red moon and others in android. If they can't access location you can simply set them up manually or set up the screen filters manually. It is as easy as that. You don't need to follow the rotation of the sun.
summary: Why does it need to access the location?

description: Had no idea Night Light was available in Fedora, now no longer need Red Shift.
summary: Great, but replaced by Night Light

description:
I'm all for problem-solving and fixing things (programme here), but as someone who just installed this app and wants to get some last bit work done without it affecting his sleep, Redshift isn't being much of a help right now on OpenSUSE.

On launch, it gives an obscure DBus-related geolocation error and then exits. So (in Gnome 3), I search for Geolocation in the Gnome 3 menu, and find nothing. Turns out it's in the Privacy settings, and I turn it on there. Why can't it just probe for Geolocation privileges, and/or allow me to specify the times I want it on manually?

Anyhow, it launches, and I see a tray icon, but I can't figure out how to interact with it since clicking the icon does nothing. So my sleep is going to be messed-up tonight.

I'm sure I'd rate this 4 or 5 stars once I figure it out, but it's $current_year(!), and I shouldn't have to use a search engine just to get a blue light filter working.

I want a refund for the $0 I paid.
summary: Obscure error on launch, no obvious way to interect with app

description: Works perfect, just wish I could easily set change to on/off whenever instead of only being based on time of day.
Great app , would recommend
This is a great app, just what your eyes need

This App is Must for anyone who works in night!

A graphical interface would have been perfect for this kind of thing though.
it works perfect
Issue with geolocation - gave an error message when I tried to launch it.
Great tool for your eyes protection against bright monitors
This tool is great against blue color of monitors

Does what it says. Never had any problems, except that sometimes, especially after a system update, it's unable to get the location automatically and when it happens it doesn't work...usually only for few hrs or a day max, though. 
HOWEVER,
A: You can set up the location manually.
B: The automatic location n/w might be because in my "geoclue.conf" file the following lines were missing:
[redshift]
allowed=true
system=false
users=
Good but could be more operative.
It would be really useful if I could set the night light whenever I want.
This works well on Kubuntu 19.10, but it doesn't have any adjustable settings. You just turn it on and off; no control over "temperature" or anything like that (everything seems to be auto).
Install redshift-gtk too, which provides a system icon for disabling it, for example: Editing Photos during the night. THEN it is perfect
summary: I wished they bundled it with redshift-gtk as standard

البرنامج ممتاز جدا لكن التحكم به سيئ على كل التوزيعات واقول سيئ لانه ليس سهلا على اي مستخدم 
ربما لو ممكن ان يتم تسحين واجهة رسومية للتحكم بالاضاءة وضبطها بطريه سهلة ولااسف اغلب الرامج على لينكس تتعامل مع المستخدمين على انهم درجة عالية من الفهم في البرامج ولا تلتفت ابدا للمستخدمين ذوي الخبرات البسيطة والمبتدئين للاسف معاناة قديمة وعلى كل حال الواجهة والتحكم بها هي العيب الوحيد وهو سبب تركي للبرنامج مدة طويلة لصالح برنامج اخر شكرا لكم واتمنى لكم التوفيق

Thanks for the software but it barely deserves 3 stars at this point. The GUI only has extremely basic toggle & suspend options. All other controls are via the terminal. Not very accessible or user friendly unfortunately. It does change the colour temperature nicely though.

It's okay if you just want to adjust your main monitor/laptop screen. It will not adjust external monitors. and will even quickly override any other changes you make manually using xrandr... presumably it is just inefficiently running CRON commands every few seconds. That seems like it would waste resources.
summary: Doesn't work with multiple monitors. GUI limited. Overrides changes

description: Does not work at all on Korora 25.

Tut was es soll zuverlässig und auch nur genaud das. Unter KDE integriert sich redshift besser mit einem passenden applet https://store.kde.org/p/998916/ („redshift-gtk“ deinstallieren, aber „redshift“ installiert lassen)

Dieses GTK widget funktioniert under KDE besser als das KDE Plasmoid, welches dafür berüchtigt ist nach einiger Zeit mehrere Instanzen von redshift zu starten und somit zu extremen Bildschirmflackern zu führen. Außerdem integriert sich dieses Widget in die KDE Systemleiste und kann somit auch ausgeblendet werden. TLDR: Bestes redshift Widget.
Diese App macht genau was sie soll -- seitdem ich sie habe, kann ichwirklich mühelos nachts und bei Kunstlicht arbeiten. Wirklich empfehlenswert.
Kann ich nur empfehlen. Schont die Augen.

Mit Redshift Display bei Dunkelheit rötlicher. Woher sind unter "Informationen" "Position"s-Koordinaten, nach denen sich der Ort bestimmen lässt? Von meinem Betriebssystem-Zeit-Standort nicht. Werden Nutzungsinfos, z. B. wann an oder aus, gesendet?

No hay que ser ingeniero de la NASA para ponerla como otras aplicaciones, muchas gracias al equipo de desarrollo de esta aplicación

description:
L'icône (ampoule pleine) apparaît bien dans le tableau de bord mais, elle ne permet le réglage que de "activité, suspendre, lancement automatique, arrêt". En aucun cas, elle ne permet de régler la température dont elle ne fait que fournir l'"information" ! 
L'applet plasma5 est installée...
J'ai déjà utilisé Redshift par de passé et à mon grand regret, ça ne fonctionne plus sous gnome (3.28) à cause de Wayaland.
A configurer depuis la console
Déjà quand j'ouvre l'application, elle se ferme, quand je redémarre, elle ne se démarre pas, c'est vraiment bizarre OwO

Fonctionne bien, mais lors du lancement de certains programmes vidéo ou audio (vlc, youtube, ardour...) se désactive pendant 2 secondes, faisant un flash lumineux de l'écran. Heureusement ensuite il se réactive. J'ai ce fonctionnement depuis l'installation (il y a 18 mois).
Но иногда (довольно редко) экран на секунду "мигает" цветом без фильтра
Было бы не плохо сделать возможность включения фильтра и в дневное время суток)

Если экран промерцывает временами, и у вас AMD карта, то приведите строчку в настройках Граба к такому виду:

sudoedit /etc/default/grub
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash amdgpu.dc=0"
sudo update-grub
Я еще вот какие настройки делаю https://forum.ubuntu.ru/index.php?topic=302256.msg2367389#msg2367389

Программа четко работает по временам суток, помогая работающим за монитором не нарушать естественные ритмы организма в цикле бодрствования-сна. Мягкий-теплый свет очень приятно воспринимается в вечернее время. Рекомендую.
summary: очень полезная программа для зрения и экологии биоритмов мозга
